trans-unit.source: Enables dynamic behavior for ASP.NET Web controls that support ASP.NET Dynamic Data.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The DynamicDataManager control provides the glue between the data-bound control, the data source control, and Dynamic Data in the following ways: - Sets a field generator for the data-bound control to create the correct column set when is set to `true`.
The data-bound control can be a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.
- Sets the context type and table name for the data source control.
The data source control for LINQ-to-SQL is <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource>.
The data source control for the ADO Entity Framework is <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EntityDataSource>.
- Sets the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.IDynamicDataSource.AutoGenerateWhereClause%2A> to `true` for the data source if there is no Where clause.
- Expands the special dynamic parameters such as <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControlParameter> into parameters that the data source can consume.
- If the LINQ-to-SQL <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager.AutoLoadForeignKeys%2A> property is set to `true`, loads the foreign keys.
The DynamicDataManager control must be included on a page in order for data controls to use Dynamic Data support.
The markup for the DynamicDataManager control must precede the markup for any controls that use Dynamic Data support.
> [!NOTE] > A DynamicDataManager control cannot be put inside an <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control.
## Declarative Syntax ``` ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether foreign keys are automatically loaded for a LINQ-to-SQL data context.
If the data model is not based on LINQ to SQL, this property is ignored.
When the property set to `true`, it causes the related entities to be loaded in the initial query.
When the property is set to `false`, LINQ to SQL will load the related objects when they are requested.
This property is only for load optimization and does not affect what is displayed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if foreign keys are automatically loaded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ClientID*> property that is generated by ASP.NET.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ClientID*> property that is generated by ASP.NET.
Gets the algorithm that is used to generate the value in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ClientID*> property.
A value that indicates how the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ClientID*> property is generated.
This property cannot be set.
Gets the list of data-control references in the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control.
The list of data-control references in the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Init"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Load"></xref> event.
The event data.
Registers a control with the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control.
To enables dynamic behavior in a control, you must register it.
The data control to register.
Registers a control with the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control.
Registering the control enables its dynamic behavior.
If the `setSelectionFromUrl` parameter is `true` and the primary key value is found in the route values, the primary key will be used to set the selected item.
The primary key value is typically passed in the route by using the query string in the request URL.
The data control to register.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to use the primary key to set the selected item; otherwise, the selected item is not set.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control is visible.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager> is not a visible run-time control.
The property is only used at design time in a designer.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> is visible; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
